claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.

verified_evidence.quote: RIV4 also induces antibodies, in both humans and mice, that are specific to epi topes in the HA head region, at greater proportions than a traditional mammalian cell derived subunit vaccine (Flu cel vax [Trivalent 77.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very similar quote appears on page 5: 'RIV4 also induces antibodies, in both humans and mice, that are specific to epi topes in the HA head region, at greater proportions than a traditional mammalian cell derived subunit vaccine (Flu cel vax [Trivalent 77.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor formatting and punctuation differences.. The quote directly states that RIV4 (a recombinant flu vaccine) induces antibodies to HA head region epitopes at greater proportions than a traditional mammalian cell-derived subunit vaccine. This supports the claim that a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine (RIV4) may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines, as it demonstrates a quantitative and qualitative difference in immune response favoring the recombinant vaccine.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: A very similar quote appears on page 5: 'RIV4 also induces antibodies, in both humans and mice, that are specific to epi topes in the HA head region, at greater proportions than a traditional mammalian cell derived subunit vaccine (Flu cel vax [Trivalent 77.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor formatting and punctuation differences.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly states that RIV4 (a recombinant flu vaccine) induces antibodies to HA head region epitopes at greater proportions than a traditional mammalian cell-derived subunit vaccine. This supports the claim that a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine (RIV4) may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines, as it demonstrates a quantitative and qualitative difference in immune response favoring the recombinant vaccine.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly compares the antibody response induced by RIV4 to that of a traditional mammalian cell-derived subunit vaccine, showing that RIV4 induces a greater proportion of antibodies to key regions, supporting the claim of a more robust antibody response.

rejected_evidence.quote: The higher quantity and greater accessibility of the genetically conserved stem region of rHA produced in insect cells (resulting in smaller N-linked glycans) may contribute to cross protection against mismatched influenza strains 12 75.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This statement explains a mechanistic reason why the recombinant (higher-dose) vaccine may induce a more robust and broader antibody response than standard egg-based vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: Thus, elimination of parts of gly cans that are not essential for HA structure may improve vaccine induced protection. Subsequent studies showed that HA with simpler gly cans induce more broadly protective antibodies with superior cross clade protection compared to HA with more complex glycans76–79.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote supports the claim by describing how the structural features of recombinant HA (as in RIV4) lead to a more broadly protective antibody response than conventional vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: In a study by Nach bag auer et al.78, RIV4 induced HA stem- specific neutral ising antibodies directed against influenza subtypes H1, H3 and B haem agglutinin in an age dependent manner in humans, with the highest titres observed in the elderly 78.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This provides direct evidence that RIV4 induces high levels of neutralizing antibodies, especially in older adults, supporting the claim of a more robust antibody response.
